text: I feel like the idea of using it in the first place misses the mark. This is not finance where it may not be possible to easily get at the fundamentals of what drive prices. We’re also not talking about prices that are unbounded, we’re talking about probabilities (even if you prefer to think in odds)

elements.text: I feel like the idea of using it in the first place misses the mark. This is not finance where it may not be possible to easily get at the fundamentals of what drive prices. We’re also not talking about prices that are unbounded, we’re talking about probabilities (even if you prefer to think in odds)

text: Not to mention that the time series are related to other runners in the same market (maybe not directly for every pairwise comparison but certainly collectively). Finite lifetime, comparitavely coarse resolution, and for inplay, convergence to either 1.01 or 1000 too. I wasted months early on in trying to adapt financial indicators to price data - MACD convergence/divergence, RSI, Bollingers etc and never got anywhere. Not saying that it is not possible but I gave up travelling in that direction afte many fruitless endeavours in that area.

elements.text: Not to mention that the time series are related to other runners in the same market (maybe not directly for every pairwise comparison but certainly collectively). Finite lifetime, comparitavely coarse resolution, and for inplay, convergence to either 1.01 or 1000 too. I wasted months early on in trying to adapt financial indicators to price data - MACD convergence/divergence, RSI, Bollingers etc and never got anywhere. Not saying that it is not possible but I gave up travelling in that direction afte many fruitless endeavours in that area.

text: I think the only reasons all those technical indicators ever work is because the markets have an upward trajectory over the long term anyway, but don't think they have value in and of themselves. Just some witchcraft

elements.text: I think the only reasons all those technical indicators ever work is because the markets have an upward trajectory over the long term anyway, but don't think they have value in and of themselves. Just some witchcraft

text: <@U01EC79GY75> has joined the channel

Just had my betfair account closed "due to potential third party access, to be on the safe side"!  My pleadings with support to keep the account open fell on deaf ears and they've made me open new account with a different email address.  Has anyone experienced this before?  My main concern is whether my API keys will be transferred to my new account, or at least re-activated

elements.text: Just had my betfair account closed "due to potential third party access, to be on the safe side"!  My pleadings with support to keep the account open fell on deaf ears and they've made me open new account with a different email address.  Has anyone experienced this before?  My main concern is whether my API keys will be transferred to my new account, or at least re-activated

text: It’s possible if your password isn’t great.  I see regular failed login attempts on the ‘security’ page from mystery IPs.

elements.text: It’s possible if your password isn’t great.  I see regular failed login attempts on the ‘security’ page from mystery IPs.

text: I would agree that it seems financial indicators may be inappropriate to translate to betting. Not least because there are fundamental factors and external information (such as TPD feed for in running horses) driving price. However I have also seen some of the big in play guys in this group state that access to GPS data is not essential... implying that the fundamental method they are using is possible with only access to price data/market books. Maybe I have misunderstood but it seems the key that noobs like me need to grasp is how to define a value criteria, perhaps one more simple than would be expected?

elements.text: I would agree that it seems financial indicators may be inappropriate to translate to betting. Not least because there are fundamental factors and external information (such as TPD feed for in running horses) driving price. However I have also seen some of the big in play guys in this group state that access to GPS data is not essential... implying that the fundamental method they are using is possible with only access to price data/market books. Maybe I have misunderstood but it seems the key that noobs like me need to grasp is how to define a value criteria, perhaps one more simple than would be expected?

text: I think it's a self-fullfilling prophecy, if people think they work they will act as if they worked, so they will base their decisions on these indicators, which in turn will make it look as if they worked, and so on...
